TextBody:
Hello,

If you are referring to google domains? You can prevent the user from login in to his personal domain from "Content Aware Protection > Deep Packet Inspection > Allowed domains for Google Business accounts".

You can set up a CAP policy to block files and allow them for certain URLs or domains. Please not if you want to allow attachments on web emails based on domain it will not work.


Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.
ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0IFayT:ref
Subject: Need help in creating rules    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0IFayT:ref ]

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Date: Wednesday, 13 November 2024 at 4:45?PM
To: Yajat Gupta <yajat.gupta@payglocal.in>
Subject: Need help in creating rules [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0IFayT:ref ]


External Email


Hello,

If you are referring to google domains? You can prevent the user from login in to his personal domain from "Content Aware Protection > Deep Packet Inspection > Allowed domains for Google Business accounts".

You can set up a CAP policy to block files and allow them for certain URLs or domains. Please not if you want to allow attachments on web emails based on domain it will not work.


Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector
